title: 2025 MLB mock draft 1.0: Who will go No. 1 to the Nationals?
content: Starting with a wide-open top of the board, here's how the first round of this July's draft could play out.

title: Baylor football player Alex Foster, 18, dies in Miss.
content: Baylor defensive lineman Alex Foster, an 18-year-old redshirt freshman, died unexpectedly early Wednesday while at home in Greenville, Mississippi.

title: Vrabel stresses decision-making amid Diggs video
content: The Patriots are aware of the video in which Stefon Diggs flashed an unidentified pink substance while surrounded by three women on a boat, coach Mike Vrabel said Wednesday.

title: Bradshaw: Steelers' interest in Rodgers 'a joke'
content: Four-time Super Bowl-winning quarterback Terry Bradshaw, a Steelers legend, isn't a fan of the Pittsburgh's pursuit of Aaron Rodgers, telling an Arkansas radio station on Tuesday that the club's interest in the 41-year-old signal-caller "is just a joke."

title: Giants' Wilson takes 1st-team reps; Nabers sits
content: Giants quarterback Russell Wilson took a majority of the first-team snaps during Wednesday's OTA practice, while star wideout Malik Nabers sat out the practice while dealing with a toe injury.

title: Astros' Blanco having elbow surgery, done for '25
content: Astros right-hander Ronel Blanco, who is 3-4 with a 4.10 ERA this season, will have surgery on his right elbow and will miss the remainder of the 2025 season.

title: Oilers' Hyman likely out for remainder of playoffs
content: Oilers forward Zach Hyman is unlikely to play again in the Stanley Cup playoffs after suffering an injury in Game 4 of the Western Conference Final.

title: CFP 5+11 model draws interest from SEC coaches
content: In a pivot from the push for automatic qualifiers in the next iteration of the College Football Playoff, the SEC on Tuesday took a heightened interest in a 16-team model that would include the five highest-ranked conference champions and 11 at-large bids.

title: Panthers' Reinhart, Mikkola, Greer back for Gm. 5
content: The Florida Panthers will get winger Sam Reinhart, defenseman Niko Mikkola and forward A.J. Greer back for Game 5 of the Eastern Conference Finals on Wednesday night against the Hurricanes.

title: The 2025 NFL season FPI projections are out: Eagles at No. 1, Saints at No. 32 in our debut ratings
content: ESPN's Football Power Index ratings are live. Let's predict the 2025 season, including playoff chances for 32 teams and potential draft order.

title: The 5 most astounding stats behind the 100-game stretch when the Tigers have ruled MLB
content: Detroit has been the best team in baseball since Aug. 11 of last season. Here's a breakdown of how it has done it.

title: How Julius Randle's dominance -- and struggles -- personifies the Wolves' teetering season
content: The Wolves and Randle are battling a similar fight: to end maddening inconsistency when it matters most.

title: 'The greatest to ever do it': How Patty Gasso built a superpower at Oklahoma
content: Former players, coaches on how Oklahoma softball coach Patty Gasso became the sport's greatest coach.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: Sources: Man United trigger Cunha release clause
content: Wolverhampton Wanderers have given Manchester United permission to conclude a deal for Matheus Cunha, sources told ESPN.

title: Henry: Arsenal have underachieved under Arteta
content: Arsenal legend Thierry Henry has said he believes the club should have won a trophy under Mikel Arteta.

title: Slot thanks football after Liverpool parade incident
content: Liverpool's Arne Slot thanked the football community for its support following the incident at Liverpool's title parade after being named LMA manager of the year.

title: UCL: Pot 1 teams will play two English clubs
content: The six non-English teams in Pot 1 of the Champions League draw will have to be given fixtures against two Premier League clubs in the league phase.

title: Maresca surprised Mudryk in Poland for final
content: Chelsea coach Enzo Maresca seemed as surprised as anyone when he was told Mykhailo Mudryk had been spotted in Poland ahead of the club's Conference League final against Real Betis.

title: Source: Liverpool's Heitinga can begin Ajax talks
content: Liverpool have granted assistant coach John Heitinga permission to enter talks with Ajax over becoming their new head coach, a source has told ESPN.

title: Mourinho: Man United right to stick with Amorim
content: Jose Mourinho believes former club Manchester United are doing the right thing by sticking with coach Ruben Amorim despite their disappointing season.

title: England's Bright out of camp due to burnout
content: Millie Bright has said she withdrew from this England camp because she is "mentally and physically" at her limit.

title: Valkyries coach Natalie Nakase making history in the WNBA
content: Former Clippers assistant Natalie Nakase helped the Aces win two WNBA titles. Now she's in her first season as the head coach of the Valkyries.

title: Storylines: Can Nelly Korda get back in the winner's circle? How will Erin Hills play?
content: The 80th U.S. Women's Open figures to be a tough test at Erin Hills Club. We break down some of the biggest things to watch ahead of the LPGA's second major of the year.

title: MAC preview: Ohio will need to fend off Toledo, Buffalo as it looks for repeat
content: Bill Connelly begins his conference previews with the MAC, which still has some high-level talent despite portal losses.

title: Game 4 grades, takeaways: Edmonton takes commanding series lead
content: What we learned and what's ahead for the Oilers, who lead the Stars 3-1 in the Western Conference finals.

title: NBA playoff futures: Thunder big favorites to take title, Pacers move up
content: With the conference finals underway, here are the updated odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP.

title: The decline of a dynasty: The Patriots had a 'difficult' two seasons. Can Mike Vrabel reignite them?﻿
content: The Patriots have revamped their front office, coaching personnel and roster after back-to-back 4-13 seasons in hopes of closing the gap in the AFC East.

title: Norris' win in Monaco has reset F1, McLaren title fight
content: Preseason title favorite Lando Norris was losing steam to teammate Oscar Piastri. That's no longer the case.

title: The unlimited potential of Brazilian prodigy Joao Fonseca
content: Joao Fonseca has drawn passionate crowds and defeated big names like Hubert Hurkacz. Is he the next tennis superstar?

title: Is this the last time we'll see line judges at a Grand Slam?
content: The French Open is the last of the majors to use human line judges -- and it's been a topic of debate in Paris.

title: Grading how every SEC team performed in 2024-25
content: With a record 14 NCAA tournament bids, it's no surprise the SEC earned the most A's among power conferences.

title: The story of Arsenal's season: Did not signing a striker cost them the title?
content: A season that began with great optimism ended with Arsenal taking one step back in the Premier League but also a leap forward in the Champions League.

title: All you need to know about the newest season of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

title: Finding the next hidden breakout aces
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft tries to figure out how to identify pitchers who might become the next big thing.

title: Emerging Valkyries pickups to stream
content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

title: Maoists Loot 4 Tonnes Of Explosives From Truck In Odisha
content: A group of 30 to 40 armed Maoists looted approximately four tonnes of explosives from a truck in Odisha's Sundargarh district.

title: Madhya Pradesh BJP MLA's Will "Cut The Tongue" Remark Sparks Row
content: In the political landscape of Madhya Pradesh, a controversy has erupted following the circulation of a video featuring BJP legislator Jagannath Singh Raghuwanshi from Chanderi, Ashoknagar district.

title: Trump Administration Uses India-Pakistan Conflict In Court To Justify Tariffs
content: The Trump administration, which has been spending a lot of its time in courts lately due to controversial orders signed by Donald Trump, has urged the American judiciary not to put a 'stay' on the US President's vastly unpopular tariffs move.

title: Man Arrested For Duping People Of Rs 20 Lakh Using Fingerprints in Delhi: Cops
content: A man has been arrested for allegedly duping multiple people of nearly Rs 20 lakh by using their fingerprints to withdraw money from their bank accounts in outer Delhi's Sultanpuri area, an official said on Wednesday.

title: "Mini-Library" At Manipur Relief Camp A Huge Success Story Of Youth Power
content: A group of young people installed three metal shelves filled with some books at a relief camp in Manipur in July 2024. They called it a "mini library".

title: PM Modi Calls Ghulam Nabi Azad, Enquires About His Health
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi called up former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Ghulam Nabi Azad and enquired about his health after he was hospitalised in Kuwait.

title: On 'Boycott Kashmir' Trend, Omar Abdullah's Big Appeal To Centre
content: Omar Abdullah was cycling on Tuesday in Pahalgam. On Wednesday, he was on a Gondola (cable car) ride in Gulmarg. The aim, he says, is to revive the tourist season, which suffered a body blow due to the deadly terror attack in Pahalgam.

title: Mumbai Man, Alleged Kingpin Of Drug Syndicate, Arrested From Malaysia
content: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has arrested a Navi Mumbai resident, alleged to be the kingpin of a "transnational drug syndicate", after securing his deportation from Malaysia, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Amazon's In-Car Software Deal With Stellantis "Winding Down"
content: Amazon's deal with Stellantis to create in-car software that companies hoped would transform the driving experience while bolstering vehicle-tech credentials is "winding down" highlighting challenges for legacy automakers in building in-car software.

title: Probe Agency Attaches Assets Worth Rs 2.34 Crore In J&K Crypto Scam
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) Srinagar said on Wednesday that it has attached two bank accounts and immovable property worth Rs 2.34 crore in a bogus cryptocurrency scam.

title: "Wasn't Even MP During Pak Visit": Gaurav Gogoi On Himanta Sarma's Charge
content: Congress's Gaurav Gogoi, the deputy leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha, who is facing BJP allegations about aiding Pakistan, today said the allegations are just BJP propaganda ahead of the assembly election in Assam.

title: Harvard Has Got To Behave, Have A 15% Cap On Foreign Students: Trump
content: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Harvard University should have a 15% cap on the number of foreign students it admits and that the Ivy League school needs to show the administration their current list of students from other countries.

title: New US Visa Rules To Ban Foreigners Who "Censor" Americans On Social Media
content: The United States is introducing a new visa ban rule for those who "censor" Americans posting comments on social media platforms that are owned by US tech firms. The announcement was made by US Secretary of State Maro Rubio.

title: Andrew Tate, Brother Face 21 Criminal Charges, Including Rape, In Britain
content: Internet personality Andrew Tate faces 11 criminal charges in Britain, including rape, actual bodily harm and human trafficking, the Crown Prosecution Service said on Wednesday.

title: Assam To Provide Arms Licences To Indigenous People In 'Vulnerable' Areas
content: The Assam government will provide arms licences to indigenous people residing in "vulnerable and remote" areas and those along the border with Bangladesh for instilling a sense of security in them, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

title: Strict RERA Compliance Critical For Restoring Housing Market Trust: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said strict compliance with RERA provisions is critical for restoring trust in the housing market while reviewing three major infrastructure projects costing over Rs 62,000 crore on Wednesday.

title: Russia Proposes To Hold Next Peace Talks With Ukraine In Istanbul On June 2
content: Russia has proposed holding the next round of direct talks with Ukraine in Istanbul on June 2 with a view to achieving a sustainable peace settlement, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday.

title: Debt, Superstition: The Suicide Pacts That Shook India
content: From an entrepreneur a few years ago to working as a taxi driver, the fall in his fortunes was steep and grim. Along the way, he also accumulated a crushing load of debt. It proved the final straw that broke him, like the proverbial camel's back.

title: Who Is Muhammad Sinwar, Hamas Chief In Gaza Declared Eliminated By Israel?
content: Muhammad Sinwar, the elusive Hamas military chief in Gaza who Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday had been eliminated, has long been at the top of Israel's most wanted list.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Loses Mistrial Bid In Sex Trafficking Trial
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs lost a bid for a mistrial in his sex-trafficking case on Wednesday, after his lawyers argued that prosecutors were improperly trying to suggest that the hip-hop mogul had evidence tied to an alleged arson incident destroyed.

title: 'Dishonest' vs 'Nationalist': Shashi Tharoor triggers another Congress-BJP slugfest
content: Shashi Tharoor's recent remarks, suggesting India first breached the LoC during the 2016 surgical strike, have ignited a fresh controversy with the Congress and the BJP engaged in a war of words. This follows Tharoor's earlier praise for PM Modi's diplomatic efforts, going against the party line. Congress leaders are countering Tharoor's statements citing past surgical strikes during the UPA regime.

title: 'Blinded, numbed, paralysed': How Op Sindoor set Pak air force back 5 yrs
content: Operation Sindoor severely damaged Pakistan's air force. Indian strikes targeted radar systems and command centers. Pakistan's air defenses were overwhelmed. Key air bases faced significant damage. Communication networks were disrupted. Pakistan sought a ceasefire after the strikes. The operation demonstrated India's ability to respond decisively. The strikes caused a five-year setback for Pakistan's air capabilities.

title: In heated call, Trump says he told Netanyahu to hold off Iran strikes
content: President Trump revealed he asked Prime Minister Netanyahu to hold off on military action against Iran, prioritizing ongoing nuclear negotiations. Trump expressed optimism about reaching a deal with Iran, citing "very good discussions" and potential for a breakthrough announcement soon.

title: Jadeja reveals two Mahendras behind his success
content: Ravindra Jadeja credits two influential figures named Mahendra, both from Bihar, for shaping his cricket career. He highlights his childhood coach, Mahendra Singh Chauhan, for instilling a strong emphasis on fitness and fielding. Jadeja also praises MS Dhoni's unparalleled greatness and Virat Kohli's relentless pursuit of victory in Test cricket, emphasizing his positive approach.

title: Op Shield: Civil defence mock drills postponed in states bordering Pak
content: Civil defence mock drills, dubbed 'Operation Shield,' scheduled for Thursday in states bordering Pakistan, including Gujarat, Haryana, Rajasthan, Punjab, and Jammu and Kashmir, have been postponed due to administrative reasons. Punjab has requested the Centre to reschedule the exercise for June 3, as their civil defence staff are currently undergoing NDRF training.

title: America’s Apparel group slams Trump after he prioritises tech over clothing manufacturing
content: President Trump prioritizes boosting U.S. manufacturing of high-tech and military equipment through tariffs, downplaying the textile industry's significance. While aiming for advancements in AI, chips, and defense, this approach faces criticism. The American Apparel & Footwear Association warns of potential harm to the industry, citing increased costs for manufacturers and higher prices for consumers.

title: ITR deadline extended: Why it may benefit taxpayers
content: The extension of the ITR filing deadline to September 15, 2025, may increase the government's interest liability on tax refunds, calculated from April 1st. Taxpayers filing by the extended deadline are still eligible for interest, but delaying may not significantly benefit them. Experts suggest early filing to expedite refunds, despite the government's manageable interest burden.

title: Bowel cancer is rising rapidly in younger people: Causes and symptoms
content: Scientists have discovered that a bacterial toxin, colibactin, may contribute to the rising rates of bowel cancer in young adults. Exposure to this toxin, produced by certain E. coli strains, during childhood could elevate the risk of developing the disease later in life. The toxin causes DNA mutations, making it more common in adults diagnosed with cancer before age 40.

title: Is Trump's 'Golden Dome' a 'pump and dump' plan to make Elon Musk richer?
content: President Trump has proposed a $175 billion "Golden Dome" missile defense system, aiming for completion by 2029. This initiative, intended to shield the US from long-range missile threats, faces scrutiny over its effectiveness and potential enrichment of allies like Elon Musk. Concerns arise regarding the project's technical challenges, immense costs, and the possibility of escalating an arms race in space.

title: Elon Musk’s 72-hr ‘ultimatum’ to Apple that may have split Tim Cook’s team
content: In 2022, Elon Musk issued a 72-hour ultimatum to Apple, demanding a $5 billion deal for SpaceX to become the exclusive satellite provider for iPhones. Apple rejected the offer, leading to a three-year conflict involving regulatory challenges and internal dissent within Apple regarding its satellite strategy. Despite the challenges and internal resistance, Apple has invested heavily in Globalstar, signaling its commitment to satellite connectivity.

title: 'Lashkar bhi tumhara ... ': Vinesh Phogat's bold reply to Brij Bhushan Singh
content: Wrestlers Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia have strongly criticised Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh after a Delhi court dismissed the POCSO Act case against him. Punia highlighted Singh's celebratory roadshow despite six other sexual harassment cases still pending. He alleges continued pressure on the remaining female wrestlers to withdraw their complaints.

title: 'Plot of C-grade movie': Gogoi clarifies wife's 'Pak links'; Assam CM doubles down on 'spy' charge
content: Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi has refuted Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's allegations of his wife's ISI connection, dismissing it as a fabricated story. Sarma claims Gogoi has ties with the Pakistani establishment and promises to reveal evidence after an investigation. Gogoi questions the timing of the accusations, while Sarma welcomes Gogoi's admission of visiting Pakistan.

title: Google DeepMind CEO 'warns' students getting into college: The world you are entering will ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI within a decade, foreseeing workplace disruption alongside the creation of engaging new jobs. He advises students to immerse themselves in AI technologies, emphasizing adaptability and continuous learning. Hassabis highlights AI, VR, AR, and quantum computing as promising fields, urging students to combine passions with core skills to thrive in the evolving AI-driven landscape.

title: ‘It can be big or beautiful’: Musk disappointed by Trump's key bill; sign of rift?
content: Elon Musk has criticized Trump's 'One Big Beautiful Bill,' deeming it a deficit-increasing spending bill. "I think a bill can be big or it could be beautiful," Musk said. "But I don't know if it could be both."

title: How China became Harvard’s greatest liability - and Trump, MAGA's latest battleground
content: In a stunning move, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security has revoked Harvard University's ability to enroll foreign students, citing alleged ties to the Chinese Communist Party and a hostile campus environment marked by antisemitism. Secretary Kristi Noem accused Harvard of CCP coordination and fostering violence, impacting over 6,000 international students.

title: US imposes visa curbs on foreign nationals who 'censor Americans'
content: The United States has declared a new visa restriction policy aimed at foreign individuals who suppress the free speech rights of American citizens abroad. Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced that this policy will target foreign officials and individuals complicit in censoring Americans. This includes those who fine, harass, or criminally charge US.

title: 'You loser’: Lip reader reveals what French First Lady told Emmanuel Macron
content: A video has surfaced showing French First Lady Brigitte Macron seemingly shoving President Emmanuel Macron in Vietnam. Reports suggest a tense exchange followed, with Brigitte allegedly uttering, 'Stay away, you loser.' While the Élysée Palace initially dismissed the clip, its authenticity was later confirmed. Macron downplayed the incident, attributing it to playful banter and criticizing the overblown reaction.

title: NFL star Stefon Diggs’ Miami yacht video with women raises eyebrows- see why
content: NFL star Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots' wide receiver, has ignited a social media frenzy after a video surfaced showing him on a Miami yacht surrounded by women on May 26, 2025. The clip, widely circulated on platforms like X and Facebook, captures Diggs handing a woman a pink bag.

title: Sebi bars ex-IndusInd Bank CEO Kathpalia, 4 others from securities markets
content: Sebi has barred former IndusInd Bank CEO Sumant Kathpalia and four others from the securities market, impounding ₹19.78 crore. The regulator alleges they traded on unpublished price-sensitive information related to an RBI directive impacting the bank. This action follows Sebi's investigation into potential accounting frauds within IndusInd Bank.

title: 'Will blacken Rahul's face': Sena (UBT) leader sparks row over 'Savarkar insult'
content: A political clash erupted within the Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance as Shiv Sena (UBT) threatened Rahul Gandhi over his remarks about Savarkar, with one leader vowing to blacken his face. Congress defended Gandhi, citing historical references and asserting their ability to handle such threats. The incident highlights tensions within the opposition coalition.

title: Haasan clarifies Tamil-Kannada remark after sparking fresh language row
content: Kamal Hasan's claim that "Kannada is born out of Tamil" ignited a language row, prompting criticism from Karnataka's Chief Minister and BJP president. Hasan later clarified that politicians, including himself, are unqualified to discuss language origins and suggested leaving it to linguists. He faced threats from Karnataka Rakshana Vedike for allegedly disrespecting Kannada.

title: 'You made Rathi feel small': Ashwin hits out at Rishabh Pant
content: Ravichandran Ashwin, who has been under scrutiny himself since the controversial run-out of Jos Buttler in IPL 2019, stood firmly in support of Lucknow Super Giants bowler Digvesh Rathi on Wednesday. Speaking on his YouTube channel, Ashwin dissected the incident involving Rathi’s attempt to dismiss Royal Challengers Bengaluru’s stand-in captain Jitesh Sharma at the non-striker’s end during their IPL 2025 clash.

title: Trump’s social media eyes $2.5 bn investment for 'bitcoin treasury'
content: Trump Media & Technology Group, operator of Truth Social, plans to secure $2.5 billion, including establishing a "bitcoin treasury." The company secured agreements with institutional investors for $1.5 billion in common stock and $1.0 billion in convertible notes.

title: Sooraj Pancholi on mom not divorcing dad despite his affairs: Top 5 news
content: Sooraj Pancholi opened up about his parents' marriage, while Triptii Dimri celebrated her new film role with a luxury car purchase. Dino Morea faced scrutiny in the Mithi River case, and Tamannaah Bhatia seemingly backed Deepika Padukone amidst film industry controversy. Nana Patekar declined a significant role in SS Rajamouli's upcoming epic film due to character unsuitability.

title: PM Modi speaks to Ghulam Nabi Azad after health scare during MP delegation tour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inquired about Ghulam Nabi Azad's health after the senior leader was hospitalized in Riyadh during an all-party MP delegation tour. Azad is now recovering in Kuwait and reports his test results are normal. BJP MP Baijayant Panda, leading the delegation, noted Azad's absence will be felt in Saudi Arabia and Algeria.

title: Will Bryce Harper play tonight against Atlanta Braves?
content: Bryce Harper exited Tuesday's game against the Braves after being struck on the right elbow by a 95 mph fastball. X-rays revealed no fractures, only a bruise, offering a sigh of relief to Phillies fans.

title: Dead Men Walking: List of terrorists killed by Israel post Oct 7
content: On October 26, 2023 — 19 days after the Hamas-led massacre on Israeli soil left over 1,200 dead and hundreds taken hostage — Israel’s Prime Minister declared, “All Hamas members are dead men walking — above and below ground, inside and outside Gaza.” It sounded like war rhetoric. It turned out to be a declaration of intent. Over the next 18 months, that promise morphed into one of the most relentless, far-reaching, and unapologetic assassination campaigns ever carried out by a democratic state.

title: Ex-Sebi chief Madhabi Buch gets clean chit over Hindenburg charges
content: The Lokpal has cleared former Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch of corruption allegations stemming from a Hindenburg Research report. The anti-corruption ombudsman deemed the complaints "untenable" and lacking credible evidence. Buch and her husband had previously refuted claims of involvement in the 'Adani money siphoning scandal', dismissing them as baseless.

title: 'Then shoot me': Inside Hasina's defiance before exit from Bangladesh
content: In August 2024, Sheikh Hasina's premiership reached a dramatic climax as protests engulfed Dhaka. Refusing to resign despite immense pressure from military officials and even her own sister, Hasina initially resisted. Ultimately, it was her son, Sajeeb Wazed Joy, who convinced her to step down, leading to her exile in India as the military took control.

title: Gambhir's angry 'selector' remark over Shreyas Iyer's exclusion
content: Shubman Gill is set to lead India in the upcoming Test series against England, with Rishabh Pant as vice-captain. Karun Nair makes a comeback after eight years, while Shreyas Iyer is notably absent. Gautam Gambhir declined to comment on Iyer's exclusion. Iyer's leadership will be tested as Punjab Kings face Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL 2025 Qualifier 1.

title: 3 Indians missing in Iran: Embassy pushes Tehran to act urgently
content: The Indian Embassy in Tehran is actively collaborating with Iranian authorities to locate three Indian citizens reported missing after traveling to Iran. Prompted by concerns raised by the families, the embassy has urged the Iranian government for an immediate and thorough investigation to ensure the safety of the missing individuals.

title: Op Sindoor: TMC's smart pivot, Congress' missed opportunity
content: Following Operation Sindoor, Abhishek Banerjee's strong stance against Pakistan resonated with the Indian diaspora in Tokyo. Shashi Tharoor criticised Trump's India-Pakistan hyphenation, but Congress missed leveraging his expertise. TMC's calibrated nationalism contrasts with Congress's approach, marked by attacks on Jaishankar. While TMC aligns with the national mood, Congress faces criticism for its messaging, potentially impacting its political narrative.

title: Manipur govt formation: 44 MLAs ready to stake claim, says BJP leader
content: Following a meeting with the governor, BJP legislator Thokchom Radheshyam Singh claimed that 44 Manipur MLAs are prepared to form a new government, citing public sentiment. The move comes amidst ongoing ethnic tensions and President's Rule, implemented after the previous chief minister stepped down due to criticism over handling the Meitei-Kuki conflict, which has caused significant unrest and displacement.

title: Chandrababu Naidu retains TDP helm after 30 years of leadership
content: N Chandrababu Naidu has been re-elected as the president of the Telugu Desam Party (TDP) for another two years. The announcement was made at the party's annual Mahanadu conclave, where TDP Election Committee Chairman Varla Ramaiah declared Naidu's unopposed election after receiving backing from around 600 TDP leaders.

title: Chandigarh reports first Covid death: Firozabad patient succumbs at GMCH
content: Chandigarh reported its first COVID-19 fatality with a 40-year-old patient from Uttar Pradesh, referred from Ludhiana, succumbing to the infection. The patient, who had no comorbidities, was admitted with severe respiratory problems and tested positive before passing away. Health authorities are on high alert, urging citizens to adhere to preventive measures and COVID-appropriate behavior to contain the spread.

title: India-Pak tensions: Civil defence drills to be held in 4 border states
content: India will conduct civil defence mock drills in Gujarat, Rajasthan, Punjab, and Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday. These drills aim to evaluate emergency response coordination and civilian evacuation plans in the event of cross-border conflicts or terror attacks. This exercise follows Operation Sindoor, India's retaliatory strike on terror camps in Pakistan and PoJK after the Pahalgam attack.

title: Bonanza for farmers: Govt hikes MSP for Kharif crops, offers low-interest loans
content: The Union Cabinet has approved increased Minimum Support Prices for 14 Kharif crops for the 2025-26 season, with the highest hike for nigerseed. Paddy MSP rises to Rs 2,369 per quintal. Simultaneously, the Modified Interest Subvention Scheme continues, offering farmers affordable credit via Kisan Credit Cards with subsidized interest rates and incentives for timely repayment.

title: Scientists warn of disastrous asteroids hidden near Venus
content: A new threat looms as scientists warn of dangerous asteroids near Venus, hidden from Earth's telescopes by the Sun's glare. These Venus co-orbitals, including asteroids like 2020 SB, pose a collision risk due to their unstable orbits. Experts urge for dedicated space missions to monitor this blind spot and enhance planetary defence, safeguarding Earth from potential catastrophic impacts.

title: 'Prajwal Revanna’s phone had 2k obscene photos, 40 videos; mother knew about it'
content: Prajwal Revanna's car driver testified that Prajwal's mother, Bhavani Revanna, was aware of his son's habit of recording intimate moments with women. The driver, N Kartik, revealed that Prajwal's phone contained numerous explicit photos and videos. After Kartik showed Bhavani the evidence, she expressed disappointment and requested him to keep the information confidential, later leading to Prajwal confronting Kartik.

title: Narrow escape for 180 passengers as Air India Express flight aborts landing in Chennai
content: An Air India flight carrying 180 passengers from Singapore narrowly avoided disaster at Chennai airport on Wednesday. The Airbus aborted its landing just before touchdown due to a high descent rate and sudden crosswinds. The pilots executed a go-around, and the flight landed safely on its second attempt 30 minutes later.

title: Tom Brady ditches NFL life for Italian women, big money & ...
content: Tom Brady is thriving post-divorce, making waves from Venice to Las Vegas. He's transitioned from NFL icon to media mogul with a record-breaking Fox Sports contract and an active role as a minority owner of the Raiders, influencing team decisions. Brady is embracing personal freedom and enjoying a new chapter filled with power and leisure.

title: Broken businesses, fractured bonds: What drove Panchkula family of 7 to mass suicide
content: Burdened by financial failures and mounting debts, Praveen Mittal, a 42-year-old, allegedly took his own life along with six family members in Panchkula. His struggles included a failed scrap business in Baddi and an unsuccessful tour company in Dehradun, leading to immense strain.

title: MLC: Aim is to get cricket in NCAA, says Seattle Orcas CEO Hemant Dua
content: Seattle Orcas CEO Hemant Dua believes cricket will carve out a space for itself in the USA. He says if Major League Cricket (MLC) along with the other stakeholders can work hand in hand, then sky is the limit for cricket's expansion in the US. In a free-wheeling interview with TimesofIndia.com, Dua spoke at length about the various issues, the challenges, the ambition, and how MLC is taking its baby steps in the USA.

title: ‘Debt-trapped’ family of four found hanging at Thiruvananthapuram home
content: In a tragic incident, a family of four was discovered deceased at their Vakkom home on Tuesday, with police suspecting suicide. The deceased are Anil Kumar, his wife Sheeja, and their two sons, Ashwin and Akash. Preliminary investigations suggest a financial crisis, exacerbated by a home loan and medical expenses from Ashwin's accident in 2019, as the potential cause.

title: 'PM chuppi todo': Congress targets Centre after US claim on India-Pak ceasefire
content: Jairam Ramesh, a Congress leader, has targeted the Modi government. This follows claims by US Commerce Secretary Howard Luttnick. Luttnick stated that President Trump used tariffs to broker a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. Ramesh is urging Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address the issue. He highlights Trump's previous assertions and similar statements from US officials.

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship begins on friday . Vanderbilt, which just won the tournament, is the no. 1 overall seed . the rest of the top eight national seeds are Texas at No. 2, Arkansas at no. 3, Auburn at no . 4, North Carolina at no no. 5, LSU at no 6 and Oregon State at no 8 .

title: Hamas Gaza chief Sinwar eliminated, says Israeli PM Netanyahu
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read more 8 books to read if you have finished the 'Harry Potter' series How to grow Bhut Jolokia, or ‘Ghost peppers’ at home in the terrace or balcony garden 10 animals one can easily spot in India but not in the US 8 Gujarati sweets every foodie should try 8 things to keep in mind while making Bir

title: Panthers-Hurricanes Game 5 preview: Can Carolina force another game?
content: the canes beat the Carolina Hurricanes 3-0 in their first Eastern Conference finals win since 2006 . the Hurricanes' odds to win the series are now -1600, adjusted from -5000 heading into game 4 . they're +1800, followed by Sergei Bobrovsky (+200).

title: 🏒 NHL free agency big board: Tier rankings
content: the salary cap is projected to rise to $95.5 million next season; $104 million in 2026-27 . it could lead to more teams comfortably retaining their own players on expiring contracts . the unrestricted free agent field is organized into different tiers .

title: Previewing the WCWS: Strengths, (relative) weaknesses for every team
content: the 2025 NCAA softball tournament's overall no. 1 seed (Texas A&M) was knocked out before the super regionals . three unseeded teams took top-7 seeds to a third game, too . do you like star power and chalk instead? despite the upsets above, four-time national champion Oklahoma has scorched its way through the postseason .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eyeing move for Cherki
content: al Hilal are looking to sign Napoli striker Victor Osimhen for around €40m . the 26-year-old is set to leave the Serie A champions after spending the last year on loan at Galatasaray .

title: NBA draft player survey: Who's the most underrated prospect in this class?
content: college basketball insider Jeff Borzello joins draft analysts Jeremy Woo and Jonathan Givony at the draft combine . a small handful received multiple votes, some were named by college teammates, others insisted players featured in ESPN's latest mock draft were still underrated . nominations for players who have since withdrawn from the draft have been omitted .

title: Power Rankings: Storm surge while Fever fall in latest edition
content: caitlin Clark's quad strain is the type of bad news all WNBA franchises must navigate . the loss of a starter is what keeps coaches and general managers awake at night . last season, the Minnesota Lynx went 3-2 without star forward Napheesa Collier .

title: Maharashtra government approves Dharavi project master plan
content: Top priority of the project should be rehabilitation of local artisans and small unit owners, says Fadnavis

title: U.S. Embassy, consulates in India put new student visa appointments on pause
content: It is unclear how long the pause on student visa appointments will continue, raising questions over admissions for Indian and other international students for the new term beginning in September 2025

title: Trump used offers of trade access to broker Indo-Pak ceasefire, claims U.S. Commerce Secretary
content: U.S. officials tell court that tariffs are key to U.S. national security, citing India-Pak ceasefire; MEA insisted ceasefire did not involve U.S. mediation; said trade was not part of talks with U.S. on Operation Sindoor

title: Vigil continues as heavy rain hits normal life in Kozhikode
content: Arrangements made to set up additional relief camps in landslide-prone areas with help of local administrators and Revenue department squads; IMD issues fresh lightning alert

title: Kalladi-Meppadi tunnel road project has received final clearance, says MLA
content: He says the launch of construction work will be announced soon after discussions with the Chief Minister

title: U.P. CM Yogi reviews preparations in Kanpur ahead of PM Modi’s visit on May 30
content: Modi will visit the city to inaugurate and lay the foundation stone for a slew of development projects

title: HC stays order finding former Coimbatore Collector, DRO, RDO, and Tahsildar guilty of contempt
content: A summer vacation Bench of Justices Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy and T.V. Thamilselvi grant interim stay for a period of four weeks following individual appeals filed by the officers

title: Assam to issue arms licences to indigenous people living in vulnerable areas
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said militarisation of such people was not the motive behind the Cabinet decision

title: Free movement, resettlement will take time, Home Ministry officials tell Meitei civil society groups
content: MHA tells FOCS this is not achievable in a few months or weeks, did not give any specific timeline to resolve issues; Gwaltabi incident viewed as an attempt to dismember the State of Manipur, says FOCS delegate

title: Manage COVID spike with risk-based, integrated approach: WHO advises member states
content: India has reported over 1,000 cases of COVID-19 this year so far, according to data released by the Central government

title: Congress accuses BJP of undermining local governance in Rajasthan
content: Opposition terms ‘one State, one election’ slogan a political stunt; questions raised over delimitation, delay in local body polls

title: ANI media moves Delhi HC against YouTuber
content: The news agency has alleged that a recent video published on Mohak Mangal’s channel contains false, misleading, and defamatory statements that have caused serious harm to its business and reputation

title: CPI MP writes a letter to all political parties calling for an impeachment against Allahabad HC judge Yashwant Varma
content: P. Sandhosh Kumar is the second Rajya Sabha member after Congress’s Vivek Tankha to raise demand, citing the constitutional empowerment of the Parliament to impeach Justice Varma.

title: Audit platforms for ‘dark patterns’, Consumer Affairs Ministry warns companies
content: Following a surge in ‘dark patterns’ - deceptive design techniques to nudge users to take certain action on apps and websites - the government told private sector players to audit their platforms

title: Webinar series by SRMIST and The Hindu to explore future of humanities and sciences
content: First session of ‘Future Conversations’ will be held on May 31 to discuss building real-world skills, with Prof. A. Vinay Kumar of SRMIST, Prof. A. Joseph Dorairaj among panelists.

title: Leading with compassion: Chief Minister releases biography of nephrologist H. Sudarshan Ballal
content: More than a traditional biography, this book serves as a vital resource for aspiring medical professionals and leaders globally

title: NHRC notice to Jharkhand over custodial death
content: The victim’s family members alleged that he was physically tortured in police custody, resulting in his death

title: Civil defence mock drill to be held on Thursday in western border States
content: The civil defence exercise "Operation Shield" will be carried out in Jammu and Kashmir, Punjab, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Haryana and Chandigarh

title: Amit Shah to visit Jammu and Poonch on May 29, 30
content: Besides reviewing the security arrangements for the Amarnath Yatra, the Minister is likely to visit Poonch, which saw killings and destruction of properties in shelling and firing from Pakistan after Operation Sindoor

title: Kozhikode Corporation to approach NHAI over waterlogging
content: The mayor says steps will be taken to address issues like waterlogging near the national highway and that members can approach the Corporation with details

title: Degree admissions: Universities see renewed interest in life sciences
content: The growth of Bengaluru as a biotechnology hub is one of the reasons for the renewed interest, according to university managements

title: Kerala govt. plans law to allow regulated culling of wild animals endangering human lives and raiding crop lands
content: Government seeks Advocate General’s opinion on whether the proposed law will conflict with the Indian Wildlife Act, 1972. It tasks Principal Secretary, Forests, to work with Principal Secretary, Law, to submit proposals for the draft Bill

title: Pakistan link: Himanta-Gaurav spat intensifies
content: The Assam Chief Minister alleged the Jorhat MP and his wife were deeply involved in anti-India activities after the latter admitted he visited Pakistan in 2013

title: Kerala HC upholds cooperative society Act amendment
content: Amendment bars members of managing committees of credit societies from contesting to the committees for more than three consecutive terms

title: Siraj and Sameer sent to central jail in Visakhapatnam
content: The two have been arrested on charges of making IEDs and plotting to trigger blasts in Vizianagaram and other places in the State, and later sent to one week police custody

title: Supreme Court directs Assam Human Rights Commission to probe allegations of police encounters
content: ‘The victims’ voices must be heard, not as a matter of courtesy but as a matter of right,’ the court said, directing the Human Rights Commission to notify the victims

title: Two men spend five months in jail after police mistake rock sugar for MDMA
content: The duo say they told DANSAF officers that they were using rock sugar as a ‘side dish’ for consuming liquor, but officers refused to pay heed and arrested them on charge of drug peddling. They were released on the 151st day of remand after a chemical test result proved their claim right. The officers say they acted on credible information and that the duo were duped

title: Inadequate diagnostic services still a critical gap in cancer care in India: NAMS report
content: Patients in India tend to present with later stage disease compared to the West, latest report by the National Academy of Medical Sciences states; nearly 200,000 new cancer cases are reported each year

title: Joint efforts by officials, NGO save a three-year-old from life on streets
content: The boy’s father, who collects scrap and plastic containers from the road side, signed a ‘surrender deed’ to leave his son in the care of District Child Protection Officer P. Dinesh Kumar

title: Did not seek shifting of HAL from Karnataka to Andhra Pradesh, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Denying media reports and political allegations to this effect, Naidu says he only sought Centre’s support to transform the State into an aerospace and defence industries hub

title: Incremental authoritarianism at work in India, says N. Ram
content: PM Modi and President Trump share an authoritarian disdain for their countries’ Constitutions, says Mr. Ram; says investigative journalism must raise social awareness to stand the test of time

title: Artificial Intelligence brings NTR to life at TDP’s Mahanadu in Kadapa
content: In the AI-generated video clip, the former Chief Minister is shown as appreciating the phenomenal rise of the TDP through the 43 years of its existence, its mission, and the future ahead

title: CAG suggests digitisation of TUDA accounts
content: The CAG team reviewed various developmental activities such as the layouts, land acquisition, and park development

title: Rain fury: KSEB suffers huge loss in Kozhikode
content: KSEB officials report the destruction of over 1,100 LT conductors and 20 HT conductors due to recent rain-related calamities

title: Be wary of criminals in politics and coverts in party, Chandrababu Naidu cautions TDP cadres
content: He cites as example how the conspirators in the Vivekananda Reddy murder case pointed the finger of blame at him

title: Need to encourage leaders like Pinarayi Vijayan: Kamal Haasan
content: Documentary, titled Pinarayi the Legend, brought out by Kerala Secretariat Employees’ Association released as part of the  fourth anniversary celebrations of the second Pinarayi-led LDF government

title: Congress takes on Modi government over India Inc’s rising foreign investments
content: Citing The Hindu report on concerns about rising outward FDI, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh blames stagnant wages, low consumption demand, tax terrorism, complicated GST rules, and poor governance
